description.narrative: Increased evidence and policymakers' capacity to (a) formulate and revise policies, guidelines and tools for new vaccines, effective vaccine management and child injury prevention, (b) support equitable delivery of quality interventions and (c) strengthen immunization and child injury surveillance systems, data collection and reporting., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Polio Eradication, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, pregnant women and children, particularly the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from benefit from equitable national policies, guidelines and tools for, and innovative monitoring and evaluation of, high impact and quality interventions for survival and development.

sector.narrative: Child health policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased evidence and policymakers? capacity to (a) formulate and revise policies, guidelines and tools for new vaccines,effective vaccine management and child injury prevention, (b) support equitable delivery of quality interventions and (c)strengthen immunization and child injury surveillance systems, data collection and reporting.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the inclusion of child injury prevention (CIP) in the revisedLaw on the Protection of Minors, especially the use of child safety seats to prevent injury during road traffic accidents. UNICEF worked with NHC to conduct a comprehensive review of the category 2 vaccine policy and financing mechanism with the objective of increasing evidence for the universal availability of pneumococcal vaccines for all children in China. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:01/02/2021

title.narrative: New vaccines included in national routine vaccination schedule, available and accessible(45308)

target.value: 2020:At least 1 new vaccine included in routine immunization schedule. Other new vaccines increasingly available and accessible

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF worked with NHC to conduct a comprehensive review of the category 2 vaccine policy and financing mechanism with the objective of increasing evidence for the universal availability of pneumococcal vaccines for all children in China.
